evidence.description: 55/45 left-right, 48/52 top-bottom - Card is slightly shifted to the right, making the left border wider. Top-to-bottom centering is excellent. Overall well within Near Mint standards.
The top corners appear sharp and clean. The bottom-left and bottom-right corners exhibit minor but distinct whitening at the tips.
The top, left, and right edges are clean. The bottom edge shows a few small spots of light whitening/silvering.
The surface is very clean and glossy. No visible scratches, scuffs, or print lines are apparent under inspection.

This card presents as Near Mint at first glance, but closer inspection reveals light wear on the bottom corners and bottom edge. The combination of these minor flaws places it firmly in the Lightly Played / PSA 8 category.
55/45 left-right, 55/45 top-bottom - Slightly off-center, favoring the left and top sides. The centering is still very good and well within Near Mint standards.
All four corners appear perfectly sharp and pristine. No signs of whitening, wear, or rounding are visible under inspection.
The edges appear immaculate. The black borders are solid and show no signs of chipping, nicks, or whitening.
The surface is clean and appears flawless. There are no visible scratches, scuffs, print lines, or indentations. Any linear patterns are attributed to photographic artifacts.

A superb example of the card, qualifying for a Gem Mint grade. Its only minor imperfection is centering that is slightly off but well within PSA 10 tolerance. The corners, edges, and surface are pristine.
Approx. 60/40 left-right - The card is noticeably off-center. The left border is significantly thinner than the right border.

The visible bottom-left corner appears sharp with potential for micro-wear not visible at this resolution. Other corners are not visible and are graded conservatively based on the visible portion of the card.
Visible edges (left, right, bottom) appear pristine and free of whitening or chips. The top edge is not visible for full assessment.
The surface is very clean with good gloss. A minor print dot is visible on the bottom black border above the artist's name. No scratches or scuffs are apparent.

The card presents very well but is held back by its 60/40 left-right centering. Visible surfaces, edges, and the one visible corner are in excellent, near-mint condition. The final grade is conservative due to the limited visibility from the provided image angle and cropping.

identity.name: Halvar, God of Battle // Sword of the Realms

evidence.description: Approx. 55/45 left-right, 55/45 top-bottom - Slightly off-center, favoring the right and bottom sides. Within Near Mint tolerance.
All four corners are perfectly sharp with no visible wear, whitening, or fuzziness.
All four edges are pristine and free of any visible nicks, chipping, or whitening.
The card surface is flawless and appears clean under inspection. No scratches, scuffs, print lines, or indentations are visible.

A pristine, pack-fresh card. Corners, edges, and surface are flawless. The only factor preventing a perfect grade is the centering, which is slightly outside the 50/50 ideal required for a Gem Mint 10.
